text: My browser (Firefox on Mac) is having trouble showing certain Unicode characters, such as ₘ (U+2098 subscript m) and ₙ (U+2099 subscript n). Is there something I can do to fix that? It makes it hard to read some docs.

elements.text: My browser (Firefox on Mac) is having trouble showing certain Unicode characters, such as ₘ (U+2098 subscript m) and ₙ (U+2099 subscript n). Is there something I can do to fix that? It makes it hard to read some docs.

text: that's probably an issue with either your locale, browser version, or font

elements.text: that's probably an issue with either your locale, browser version, or font

text:
For me (Firefox on Linux) the subscripts come from Deja Vu Mono, while the rest is Roboto.
Maybe you can install that?

text:
Right click on the box -> Inspect element.
On the right hand side you can hove the fonts to see which character is coming from which font. In the CSS box left to that you can scroll around to find that list. Used fonts are underlined.

elements.text:
Right click on the box -> Inspect element.
On the right hand side you can hove the fonts to see which character is coming from which font. In the CSS box left to that you can scroll around to find that list. Used fonts are underlined.

text: On macOS you should be picking up the STIX fonts, which are all installed by the system (in /System/LIbrary/Fonts), and these are the ones used on my Firefox for this page's adventurous character choices. It's not easy to persuade browsers to use local fonts, in my experience - something to do with security?

elements.text: On macOS you should be picking up the STIX fonts, which are all installed by the system (in /System/LIbrary/Fonts), and these are the ones used on my Firefox for this page's adventurous character choices. It's not easy to persuade browsers to use local fonts, in my experience - something to do with security?

text:
Thank you to everyone in this thread! I did the following two steps:
1. Uninstall and reinstall the DejaVu Sans Mono fonts
2. Uninstall Firefox, delete all Firefox folders, reboot computer, reinstall Firefox

And now it finally works!

elements.text:
Thank you to everyone in this thread! I did the following two steps:
1. Uninstall and reinstall the DejaVu Sans Mono fonts
2. Uninstall Firefox, delete all Firefox folders, reboot computer, reinstall Firefox

And now it finally works!

text: Thanks everyone for holding my hand through this!

elements.text: Thanks everyone for holding my hand through this!

text: Phew, glad you got it working :+1:

elements.text: Phew, glad you got it working
Good stuff! When you want to level up, create a file
userContent.css
in a folder called
chrome
in your profile (that Firefox hides from you) with this:
and all your code will be in the same font...
Although nothing in the world of fonts is 100% predictable.
